topics.body:
Here's something interesting: you know how cause of computers the print industry has gone to shit?

Well one of the biggest reasons why computers haven't completely taken over yet is because in order for computers to completely take over computers for basic shit have to become cheaper like to the point they're easily replaceable.

Well micro computers that are for consumers are getting there.  $50 will get you a small micro computer that is about 500mhz and such, not including the screen.

What do I mean by this?  Well in say ten years "books" might become very thin screens that each have a book stored on them that only a couple dollars to manufacture.


Tl:dr; what "books" might become:
!http://cdn.slashgear.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/lg_g_flex_display_sg_3-580x341.jpg!
